item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，谷歌将为美国政府提供折扣云计算服务
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周五援引美国总务管理局（GSA）一位高级官员的话报道称，谷歌将为美国政府提供的云计算服务大幅打折，交易可能在几周内敲定。【原文：Google will heavily discount cloud computing services for the U.S. government in a deal that could be finalised within weeks, the Financial Times reported on Friday, citing a senior official at the General Services Administration (GSA).】

item.title: 期限表显示，日产汽车出售债券融资 45 亿美元
item.description: 据路透社周五查阅的一份条款书显示，日本日产汽车公司已发行 45.2 亿美元的美元和欧元高级无担保债券，募集资金将用于为现有债务再融资。【原文：Japan's Nissan Motor has raised $4.52 billion in U.S. dollar- and euro-denominated senior unsecured bonds, according to a term sheet reviewed by Reuters on Friday, with the proceeds intended to refinance existing debt.】

item.title: 特斯拉将于 7 月 15 日在孟买开设印度首家专卖店
item.description: 电动汽车制造商特斯拉（Tesla）周五表示，将于7月15日在印度金融中心孟买开设首家展厅，并将其称为 "体验中心"，从而进一步拉近了在印度的销售距离。【原文：Electric vehicle maker Tesla inched closer to start its sales in India, as it said on Friday it would be opening its first showroom at the financial hub of Mumbai on July 15, dubbed as an "experience center".】

item.title: 日经新闻》称，松下将推迟美国电动汽车电池计划，原因是特斯拉销售缓慢
item.description: 据《日经商业日报》周五报道，松下控股公司计划推迟其在美国堪萨斯州新建的电动汽车电池厂在2027年3月前实现满负荷生产的计划，因为其主要客户特斯拉公司（Tesla）销售低迷。【原文：Panasonic Holdings plans to postpone its plan to bring its new electric vehicle battery plant in the U.S. state of Kansas to full capacity by March 2027 as Tesla , its main customer, is experiencing sluggish sales, the Nikkei business daily said on Friday.】

item.title: 审计发现违规行为后，中国奇瑞、比亚迪或需偿还补贴
item.description: 中国工业部的一项审计发现，奇瑞（CHERY.UL）和比亚迪在截至 2020 年的五年内销售的环保汽车共不当申请了 5300 万美元的政府补贴，占不当申请的近 60%。【原文：China's Chery (CHERY.UL) and BYD improperly claimed a combined $53 million in government subsidies for eco-friendly vehicles sold in the five years to 2020, accounting for nearly 60% of improper claims, an industry ministry audit found.】

item.title: 电动卡车销量飙升对中国柴油车使用造成新的打击
item.description: 在补贴和充电桩快速推广的推动下，电动重型卡车在中国的市场份额迅速扩大，进一步抑制了柴油的使用，并削弱了全球最大原油进口国对石油的需求。【原文：Electric-powered heavy trucks are rapidly gaining market share in China, driven by subsidies and the quick rollout of chargers, further curbing diesel usage and denting oil demand from the world's biggest crude importer.】

item.title: 彭博新闻社报道：特朗普的铜关税计划将包括半成品
item.description: 彭博新闻社周四援引知情人士的话报道称，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对铜征收50%关税的计划将包括半成品，如用于电网、军事和数据中心的半成品。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump's plans to impose 50% tariffs on copper would include semi-finished products such as those used for power grids, the military and data centers, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 特朗普宣布征收新关税，美元上涨，卢比下跌
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布征收更多关税，并表示计划对大多数贸易伙伴一律征收 15%或 20%的关税，全球贸易格局出现更多动荡迹象，美元周五上涨。【原文：The U.S. dollar rose on Friday on more signs of upheaval in the global trade landscape, as U.S. President Donald Trump announced more tariffs and said he planned to impose blanket levies of 15% or 20% on most trade partners.】

item.title: 特朗普宣布对加拿大和欧盟征收关税后，华尔街和欧洲期货下滑；美元上涨
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普加强对欧洲和加拿大的关税威胁之后，周五亚洲的美国和欧洲股票期货下滑，扼杀了该地区股市早盘的反弹。【原文：U.S. and European stock futures slid in Asia on Friday after President Donald Trump stepped up tariff threats against Europe and Canada, snuffing out an early rally in regional share markets.】

item.title: 油价小幅回升，但受美国关税和欧佩克降级影响
item.description: 受美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）新关税（预计将损害经济增长）和欧佩克（OPEC）需求预测下调的影响，油价在上一交易日下跌2%后，周五早盘企稳。【原文：Oil prices steadied in early trading on Friday following a 2% drop in the previous session that was driven by U.S. President Donald Trump's new tariffs, expected to hurt economic growth, and a cut to OPEC demand forecasts.】

item.title: 特朗普对加拿大征收 35% 的关税，对其他国家征收 15%-20% 的关税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周四表示，美国将于下月对从加拿大进口的商品征收35%的关税，并计划对其他大多数贸易伙伴一律征收15%或20%的关税。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday the United States would impose a 35% tariff on imports from Canada next month and planned to impose blanket tariffs of 15% or 20% on most other trade partners.】

item.title: 特朗普宣布对加拿大征收 35% 的关税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周四宣布，从8月1日起对从加拿大进口的商品征收35%的关税。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday announced a 35% tariff rate for goods imported from Canada, starting August 1.】

item.title: 高盛任命本-华莱士为美洲地区并购联席主管
item.description: 根据路透社看到的一份内部备忘录，高盛集团周四任命本-华莱士（Ben Wallace）为美洲并购部门联席主管。【原文：Goldman Sachs appointed Ben Wallace as co-head of Mergers and Acquisitions division in the Americas on Thursday, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 佛罗里达州总检察长调查 Robinhood Crypto 声称的低成本交易
item.description: 佛罗里达州总检察长詹姆斯-乌斯迈尔（James Uthmeier）周四对 Robinhood Crypto 发起调查，称该平台可能误导了客户，宣传自己是购买加密货币的最便宜方式。【原文：Florida Attorney General James Uthmeier on Thursday launched an investigation into Robinhood Crypto, alleging that the platform may have misled customers by promoting itself as the least expensive way to buy cryptocurrencies.】

item.title: 贾里德-卡弗卸任后，耐克任命内部人士为匡威新任首席执行官
item.description: 耐克在路透社周四看到的一份内部备忘录中表示，匡威总裁兼首席执行官贾里德-卡弗（Jared Carver）将卸任，由公司长期高管亚伦-凯恩（Aaron Cain）接任。【原文：Nike said in an internal memo seen by Reuters on Thursday that Jared Carver, president and CEO of Converse, would step down and be succeeded by longtime company executive Aaron Cain.】

item.title: 律师事务所 Dechert 称指控其使用雇佣黑客的诉讼已获解决
item.description: 总部位于费城的 Dechert 律师事务所周四表示，指控其利用雇佣的黑客在法庭上获胜的两起美国诉讼已在不承认任何责任的情况下得到解决。【原文：Philadelphia-based law firm Dechert said on Thursday that a pair of U.S. lawsuits accusing it of using hired hackers to win in court have been resolved without any admission of liability.】

item.title: 美国 50%的关税率会如何影响巴西的出口
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示，他计划从 8 月 1 日起对来自巴西的所有产品征收 50%的关税，这可能会对南美的农业强国产生剧烈影响。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said he plans to impose 50% tariffs on all products from Brazil starting August 1, which could have a sharp impact on South America's agricultural powerhouse.】

item.title: 交易日：新高，几乎无消息
item.description: 了解推动全球市场的各种力量【原文：Making sense of the forces driving global markets】

item.title: 特朗普对巴西商品加征关税可能抬高美国汉堡价格
item.description: 为此，食品生产商加大了进口力度。【原文：Food makers have ramped up imports in response.】

item.title: 司法部批准 T-Mobile 44 亿美元收购 UScellular
item.description: 美国反垄断执法机构周四批准了 T-Mobile 以 44 亿美元收购 UScellular 的交易，并称虽然移动运营商之间的合并令人担忧，但 UScellular 的用户将从该交易中获得更可靠的服务。【原文：The U.S. antitrust enforcers greenlit T-Mobile's $4.4 billion acquisition of UScellular on Thursday, saying that while consolidation among cell carriers is concerning, UScellular customers would get more reliable service from the deal.】

item.title: 博伊德博彩公司将以 17.6 亿美元出售其持有的 FanDuel 集团 5%的股份
item.description: 博伊德博彩公司（Boyd Gaming）和 Flutter Entertainment 公司周四表示，博伊德博彩公司将以约 17.6 亿美元的价格向 Flutter Entertainment 出售其在 FanDuel 集团持有的 5%股权。【原文：Boyd Gaming will sell its 5% equity interest in FanDuel Group to Flutter Entertainment for about $1.76 billion, the companies said on Thursday.】

item.title: 白宫就美联储财务和项目超支问题抨击鲍威尔
item.description: 白宫周四对美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）发起了新一轮攻击，特朗普政府的一位高级官员称鲍威尔对央行的管理 "严重失当"，并斥责鲍威尔管理赤字和大楼翻新工程大量超支。【原文：The White House on Thursday launched a fresh attack on Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, with a top Trump administration official saying Powell had "grossly mismanaged" the central bank, chastising him for running a deficit and for extensive cost overruns for building renovations.】

item.title: 面对特朗普的关税，巴西石油可能找到新去处
item.description: 专家告诉路透社记者，如果美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周三宣布的50%关税于8月1日生效，巴西拥有物流和商业灵活性来保持其石油在国际市场上的竞争力。【原文：Brazil has logistical and commercial flexibility to preserve the competitiveness of its oil on the international market if the 50% tariff announced by U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday comes into effect on August 1, experts told Reuters.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，英伟达黄仁勋在出访中国前会见特朗普
item.description: 据彭博新闻社（Bloomberg News）周四报道，英伟达公司首席执行官黄仁勋将于周四在白宫会见美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）。【原文：Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang will meet U.S. President Donald Trump at the White House on Thursday, a day before the former's planned trip to China, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday.】

item.title: Magnum 冰激凌公司任命乔尚南-森夫（Jochanan Senf）为 Ben & Jerry's 首席执行官
item.description: Magnum 冰淇淋公司周四表示，已任命 Jochanan Senf 为 Ben & Jerry's 全球首席执行官，7 月中旬生效。【原文：The Magnum Ice Cream Company said on Thursday it has appointed Jochanan Senf as the global chief executive officer of Ben & Jerry's, effective mid-July.】

item.title: 尽管关税带来痛苦，但欧洲牛仔布需求稳定，李维-斯特劳斯（Levi Strauss）上调年度预期
item.description: 李维-施特劳斯公司周四上调了全年营收和利润预期，此前该公司的季度业绩超出预期，该公司认为在关税不确定的情况下，欧洲等地区对其牛仔服装的需求将十分强劲。【原文：Levi Strauss raised its annual revenue and profit forecasts after beating quarterly estimates on Thursday, betting on strong demand for its denims in regions such as Europe in the face of tariff uncertainty.】

item.title: 英伟达收盘市值达到创纪录的 4 万亿美元
item.description: 英伟达（Nvidia）的股票市值周四收盘时首次超过 4 万亿美元，巩固了这家人工智能芯片制造商作为华尔街最受青睐股票之一的地位。【原文：Nvidia's stock market value ended the trading session above $4 trillion for the first time on Thursday, solidifying the AI chipmaker's position as one of Wall Street's most-favored stocks.】

item.title: 备忘录显示，Indeed、Glassdoor 将在人工智能整合过程中裁员 1300 人
item.description: 根据路透社周四看到的一份备忘录，Indeed 和 Glassdoor 的日本母公司 Recruit Holdings 将在两个招聘网站上裁员约 1300 人，重点转向人工智能。【原文：Recruit Holdings , the Japanese parent of Indeed and Glassdoor, will reduce headcount by around 1,300 across the two job sites amid a shift in focus toward artificial intelligence, according to a memo seen by Reuters on Thursday.】

item.title: 美联储主席戴利表示今年仍有两次降息机会
item.description: 旧金山联邦储备银行行长玛丽-戴利（Mary Daly）周四表示，降息的时机已经临近，但她并未透露何时应该降息。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco President Mary Daly said on Thursday the time to cut rates is nearing, without saying when she believes that should happen.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉债券持有人要求纽约法院保护其权利
item.description: 委内瑞拉国家石油公司（PDVSA）违约的一笔关键债券的持有人周四要求纽约一名法官确保他们能从委内瑞拉拥有的美国炼油商 Citgo Petroleum 母公司股份拍卖的预期收益中获得赔偿。【原文：Holders of a key bond defaulted by Venezuela's state oil company PDVSA asked a New York judge on Thursday to ensure they can claim compensation from proceeds expected in an auction of shares in the parent of Venezuela-owned U.S. refiner Citgo Petroleum.】
